intro: Bidaria pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered bidaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Bidaria pubiflora typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
